content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) – Smelts iron ore into iron plates to support crafting.
• Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) – Extracts iron ore.
• Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) – Transfers ore from the extraction point.
• Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5) – Delivers extracted ore.
• Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5) – Stores delivered ore.
• Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5) – Feeds ore to a remote branch.
• Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) – Moves ore along the intermediate belt.
• Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) – Receives ore for further routing.

### Copper Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace (position: -27.0, -60.0) – Smelts copper ore into copper plates; production now reflected in the furnace result.

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
• Lab (position: 0.5, 2.5) – Processes science packs.
• Offshore Pump (position: -7.5, 25.5) – Draws water to support lab operations.
• Boiler (position: 2.0, 17.5) – Intended to connect at (2.5, 19.5); remains not connected due to persistent fluid connection issues.
• Steam Engine (position: 5.5, 5.5) – Generates electricity; integration pending because of missing fluid input.

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine (position: 3.5, 0.5) – Configured for pipe crafting; currently reports missing electricity and insufficient iron-plate resources.
• Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores crafted pipes.
• Electricity Network – A series of small electric poles linking the production components.

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Fluid Connection Candidate Not Found Errors
  - Repeated attempts to establish a fluid connection near (-1.5, 17.5) have failed due to the absence of a candidate PipeGroup. Previous attempts used fluid_system IDs [52900, 53042, 53184, 53326, 53468, 53610, 53752, 53894, 54036, 54178, 54320, 54462, 54604, 54746, 54888, 55030, 55172, 55314, 55456, 55598, 55740, 55882, 56024, 56166, 57444, 57586, 57728, 57870, 58012, 58154, 58296, 58438] and additional attempts with IDs [58580, 58722, 58864, 59006, 59148, 59290, 59432, 59574]. Verify that a valid PipeGroup with the matching fluid_system exists at the target coordinate and that the correct identifiers are used.
  
• Manual Pipe Placement Issues
  - Confirm the target tile is unoccupied before attempting placement.

• Insufficient Inventory for Fluid Connections
  - Ensure all necessary pipes and related resources are available prior to connection attempts.

• Crafting Sub-Ingredient Limitations
  - Supply sufficient sub-ingredients (e.g., iron-plate) to support assembling machine operations.

• Assembling Machine Resource and Power Issues
  - Connect the assembling machine to a stable power network and provide the missing resources to enable production.

────────────────────────
NAMESPACE
────────────────────────
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
  Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position; returns the entity on success or raises an exception if not found.

• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
  Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.

• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
  Rotates the given entity to the specified direction to correct its alignment during placement.

• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
  Attempts to insert a specified quantity of the resource into the target inventory; returns the updated target on success or raises an exception if the resource is unavailable.

• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
  Calculates the number of pipe segments required to establish a fluid connection between a virtual candidate and the boiler’s connection point; raises an exception if conditions are not met.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the working offshore pump entity at position (-7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) – Represents the boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) – Candidate intermediate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) – Candidate intermediate connection point for linking the Boiler.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the Boiler’s water supply at (2.5, 19.5).
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the Steam Engine’s steam input at (5.5, 5.5).
• pipe_count (int) – Represents the current number of pipes available in the inventory.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipeline segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of inventory item counts after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) – Virtual candidate connection point used for manual pipe placement at (-1.5, 17.5).
